name: Name and territory of the Union
description: Article 1 declares that India, also known as Bharat, shall be a Union of States. This emphasizes the indestructible nature of the Union, meaning no state has the right to secede. It also specifies that the territory of India includes: (a) the territories of the States, (b) Union Territories, and (c) any territories that may be acquired by the Government of India.

name: Admission or establishment of new States
description: Article 2 empowers Parliament to admit into the Union, or establish, new States on such terms and conditions as it thinks fit. This provides flexibility for the Union to incorporate new territories or political units, whether by political agreement, integration, or acquisition, and grant them full statehood under conditions set by Parliament.

name: Formation of new States and alteration of areas, boundaries or names of existing States
description: Article 3 authorizes Parliament to create new States, or change the area, boundaries, or names of existing States. Before introducing such a Bill, the President must refer it to the Legislature of the affected State for its views within a specified period. However, Parliament is **not bound** to accept the States opinion. This Article ensures national flexibility for reorganizing States to address linguistic, administrative, or political considerations.

name: Laws made under Articles 2 and 3 to provide for amendment of the First and Fourth Schedules and supplemental, incidental and consequential matters
description: Article 4 states that any law made under Articles 2 or 3 may amend the First Schedule (which lists States and Union Territories) and the Fourth Schedule (allocation of Rajya Sabha seats). Such amendments do **not** count as Constitutional Amendments under Article 368. This means Parliament can reorganize the territory of India through a normal legislative process without needing the more rigid constitutional amendment procedure.

name: Citizenship at the commencement of the Constitution
description: Article 5 grants Indian citizenship at the commencement of the Constitution to anyone domiciled in India who was born in India, had parents born in India, or had been ordinarily resident in India for at least five years immediately before January 26, 1950.

name: Rights of citizenship of certain persons who migrated from Pakistan to India
description: People who migrated from Pakistan to India before July 19, 1948, are granted citizenship if they or their parents were born in India. Those who came after that date must register themselves to obtain citizenship. This Article addresses the migration that occurred during Partition.

name: Rights of citizenship of certain migrants to Pakistan
description: Individuals who migrated to Pakistan after March 1, 1947, cease to be Indian citizens. However, those who later return to India under a permit of resettlement or permanent return can regain Indian citizenship. This provision distinguishes between temporary visits and permanent migration.

name: Rights of citizenship of persons of Indian origin residing outside India
description: People of Indian origin living outside India—who themselves or whose parents or grandparents were born in India—are entitled to citizenship if they register at an Indian diplomatic or consular office. This offers citizenship rights to the Indian diaspora.

name: Persons voluntarily acquiring citizenship of a foreign State not to be citizens
description: Any person who voluntarily acquires citizenship of a foreign country is not an Indian citizen. This establishes the principle that India does not permit dual citizenship in terms of political nationality.

name: Continuance of the rights of citizenship
description: Every citizen of India retains citizenship rights subject to any laws made by Parliament. This Article ensures continuity while allowing Parliament to regulate citizenship through legislation, such as the Citizenship Act.

name: Parliament to regulate the right of citizenship by law
description: Parliament has the power to make laws regarding acquisition, termination, and other aspects of citizenship. This Article grants Parliament full legislative authority to define citizenship rules beyond the initial constitutional provisions.

name: Definition of the State
description: Defines 'State' to include the Government, Parliament, State Legislatures, local authorities, and government-controlled bodies for enforcement of fundamental-rights.

name: Laws inconsistent with or in derogation of fundamental-rights
description: Any law violating fundamental-rights is void. Future laws must also comply with fundamental-rights.

name: Right to Equality
description: Guarantees equality before the law and equal protection of the laws within India.

name: Prohibition of discrimination
description: Prohibits discrimination on religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth. Permits affirmative action for women, children, backward classes, and SC/STs.

name: Equality of opportunity in public employment
description: Ensures equal opportunity in state employment. Allows reservations for backward classes, SC/STs, and economically weaker sections.

name: Abolition of Untouchability
description: Prohibits untouchability in any form. Enforcement is punishable by law.

name: Abolition of titles
description: Abolishes titles except military or academic distinctions. Prohibits citizens from accepting foreign titles.

name: Protection of certain freedoms,right to speech,right to expression
description: Guarantees six freedoms: speech and expression, assembly, association, movement, residence, and profession/occupation. Subject to reasonable restrictions.

name: Protection in respect of conviction for offences
description: Provides protections against ex post facto laws, double jeopardy, and self-incrimination.

name: Right to life and personal liberty
description: No person shall be deprived of life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law. Expanded to include dignity, privacy, livelihood, clean environment, etc.

name: Right to education
description: State must provide free and compulsory education for children aged 6–14 years.

name: Protection against arrest and detention
description: Provides safeguards such as right to be informed of grounds of arrest, consult a lawyer, and be produced before a magistrate. Contains provisions for preventive detention.

name: Prohibition of human trafficking and forced labor
description: Prohibits trafficking, begar, and forced labor. Violations are punishable.

name: Prohibition of child labor
description: Prohibits employment of children below 14 years in factories, mines, and hazardous occupations.

name: Freedom of conscience and religion
description: All persons are free to profess, practice, and propagate religion, subject to public order, morality, and health.

name: Freedom to manage religious affairs
description: Religious denominations may establish institutions, manage affairs, own property, and administer them.

name: Freedom from paying taxes for promotion of any particular religion
description: No person shall be compelled to pay taxes for promotion or maintenance of a specific religion.

name: Freedom as to attendance at religious instruction
description: No religious instruction to be provided in fully government-funded institutions. Permitted in institutions administered by religious bodies.

name: Protection of minorities’ cultural and educational rights
description: Protects interests of cultural, linguistic, and religious minorities.

name: Right of minorities to establish educational institutions
description: Minorities may establish and administer educational institutions. State cannot discriminate in granting aid.

name: Compulsory acquisition of property (Repealed)
description: Originally protected property rights; repealed by the 44th Amendment. Property rights now under Article 300A.

name: Right to Constitutional Remedies
description: Allows individuals to move the Supreme Court for enforcement of fundamental-rights. Empowers the Court to issue writs like habeas corpus, mandamus, prohibition, certiorari, and quo warranto.

name: Power of Parliament to modify fundamental-rights for armed forces
description: Parliament may restrict fundamental-rights of armed forces, police, intelligence agencies for discipline and security.

name: Restriction on rights during martial law
description: Allows Parliament to indemnify government actions during martial law.

name: Legislation to give effect to fundamental-rights
description: Parliament has exclusive power to create laws related to certain fundamental-rights, such as preventive detention, abolition of untouchability, and human trafficking.

name: Definition
description: Defines 'State' for Part IV as the same meaning assigned in Article 12 for fundamental-rights. This includes the Government, Parliament, State Legislatures, local bodies, and government-controlled authorities.

name: Application of the principles
description: Declares that Directive Principles are fundamental to the governance of the country and it is the duty of the State to apply these principles in making laws. The provisions are not enforceable in courts but are nonetheless essential for achieving social and economic democracy.

name: State to secure a social order for the promotion of welfare of the people
description: Directs the State to promote the welfare of the people by securing a social order based on justice—social, economic, and political. After the 44th Amendment, the State must also minimize inequalities in income, status, facilities, and opportunities.

name: Certain principles of policy to be followed by the State
description: The State must direct its policy toward ensuring: (a) adequate means of livelihood for all citizens; (b) equitable distribution of resources; (c) prevention of wealth concentration; (d) equal pay for equal work; (e) protection of workers, children, and youth; and (f) opportunities for healthy development of children.

name: Equal justice and free legal aid
description: Directs the State to ensure justice is not denied to any citizen due to economic or other disadvantages. Mandates free legal aid and establishment of a justice delivery system promoting equal opportunity.

name: Organisation of village panchayats
description: The State shall take steps to organize village panchayats and endow them with necessary powers and authority to function as self-governing units.

name: Right to work, to education, and to public assistance
description: Directs the State to provide the right to work, education, and public assistance in cases of unemployment, old age, sickness, and disability, subject to economic capacity.

name: Provision for just and humane working conditions
description: The State shall provide humane working conditions and maternity relief.

name: Living wage for workers
description: Directs the State to secure a living wage, decent standard of life, and improve conditions for workers. Also promotes cottage industries in rural areas.

name: Participation of workers in management
description: Inserted by the 42nd Amendment, it requires the State to secure worker participation in management of industries.

name: Promotion of cooperatives
description: Inserted by the 97th Amendment, it directs the State to promote voluntary formation, autonomous functioning, and democratic control of cooperative societies.

name: Uniform Civil Code
description: The State shall endeavor to secure a Uniform Civil Code for all citizens throughout India to promote national integration and equality.

name: Early childhood care and education
description: The State shall provide early childhood care and education for all children until they complete the age of six years. Modified by the 86th Amendment to align with the Right to Education.

name: Promotion of educational and economic interests of SCs, STs, and weaker sections
description: Directs the State to protect the educational and economic interests of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and weaker sections, ensuring freedom from social injustice and exploitation.

name: Duty of the State to improve nutrition and public health
description: The State must raise the level of nutrition, standard of living, and public health, and prohibit the use of intoxicating drinks and harmful drugs except for medicinal purposes.

name: Organisation of agriculture and animal husbandry
description: Directs the State to modernize agriculture, preserve and improve animal breeds, and prohibit the slaughter of cows and cattle where possible.

name: Protection and improvement of environment
description: Inserted by the 42nd Amendment, it mandates the State to protect forests and wildlife and improve the environment.

name: Protection of monuments and national heritage
description: The State shall protect monuments, places, and objects of artistic or historic interest.

name: Separation of judiciary from executive
description: Directs the State to separate the judiciary from the executive in public services to ensure independence of the judiciary.

name: Promotion of international peace and security
description: The State shall promote international peace, respect international law, maintain just relations between nations, and encourage settlement of disputes through arbitration.

name: Fundamental Duties
description: Article 51A lists the Fundamental Duties of every citizen of India. These duties were added by the 42nd Constitutional Amendment (1976) based on the recommendations of the Swaran Singh Committee. They serve as moral obligations promoting responsible citizenship and national unity.
To abide by the Constitution and respect its ideals and institutions, the National Flag, and the National Anthem.
To cherish and follow the noble ideals that inspired the national struggle for freedom.
To uphold and protect the sovereignty, unity, and integrity of India.
To defend the country and render national service when called upon to do so.
To promote harmony and the spirit of common brotherhood among all people of India and to renounce practices derogatory to the dignity of women.
To value and preserve the rich heritage of India's composite culture.
To protect and improve the natural environment including forests, lakes, rivers, wildlife, and to have compassion for living creatures.
To develop scientific temper, humanism, and the spirit of inquiry and reform.
To safeguard public property and abjure violence.
To strive toward excellence in all spheres of individual and collective activity.
For parents or guardians to provide opportunities for education to their child or ward between the ages of six and fourteen years.

name: The President of India
description: Establishes the office of the President as the head of the Union Executive.

name: Executive Power of the Union
description: Vests the executive power of the Union in the President, exercisable directly or through subordinate officers.

name: Election of President
description: The President is elected by an electoral college consisting of elected MPs and elected MLAs of the states.

name: Manner of Election of President
description: Provides proportional representation by means of single transferable vote to ensure uniformity among states.

name: Term of Office of President
description: The President holds office for five years and may resign earlier; removal is done by impeachment.

name: Eligibility for Re-Election
description: Allows the President to be re-elected for any number of terms.

name: Qualifications for Presidency
description: Must be a citizen of India, at least 35 years old, and qualified to be elected as a Lok Sabha member.

name: Conditions of President’s Office
description: President cannot hold any office of profit and is entitled to official residence and emoluments.

name: Oath or Affirmation of President
description: President swears to preserve, protect, and defend the Constitution.

name: Impeachment of President
description: Details the procedure for impeachment for violation of the Constitution; requires special majority.

name: Time of Election to Fill Vacancy
description: Election to fill a vacancy in the office of President must be held within six months.

name: The Vice-President of India
description: Provides for the office of the Vice-President.

name: Vice-President as Chairman of Rajya Sabha
description: The Vice-President serves as the ex-officio Chairman of the Council of States.

name: Vice-President to Act as President
description: Vice-President discharges the functions of President during vacancy or absence.

name: Election of Vice-President
description: Vice-President is elected by members of both Houses of Parliament.

name: Term of Office of Vice-President
description: Holds office for five years; can resign or be removed.

name: Time of Election to Fill Vacancy of Vice-President
description: Election must be held to fill vacancy before expiry or soon after vacancy occurs.

name: Oath or Affirmation of Vice-President
description: Administered by the President or a designated person.

name: Discharge of President’s Functions in Contingencies
description: Parliament may provide additional rules for discharging President's functions.

name: Matters Relating to Election of President and Vice-President
description: Election disputes are decided by the Supreme Court.

name: Pardoning Power of President
description: Allows granting of pardon, reprieve, respite, remission, or commutation of sentences.

name: Extent of Executive Power of the Union
description: Union executive power extends to matters on which Parliament may legislate.

name: Council of Ministers to Aid and Advise President
description: President acts on the aid and advice of the Council of Ministers; advice is binding.

name: Provisions as to Ministers
description: Prime Minister appointed by President; Council collectively responsible to Lok Sabha.

name: Attorney-General for India
description: Chief legal advisor to the Central Government; may participate in Parliament without voting rights.

name: Conduct of Government Business
description: President makes rules for allocation and transaction of government business.

name: Duties of Prime Minister
description: PM must keep the President informed of government decisions and legislative proposals.

name: Constitution of Parliament
description: Parliament consists of the President and two Houses: the Council of States (Rajya Sabha) and the House of the People (Lok Sabha).

name: Composition of Rajya Sabha
description: Rajya Sabha includes representatives of states and union territories and nominated members; total membership is prescribed by law.

name: Composition of Lok Sabha
description: Lok Sabha consists of representatives directly elected by citizens; seats allocated to states and union territories as per population.

name: Readjustment after Census
description: Parliament must readjust the allocation of seats in Lok Sabha after each census.

name: Duration of Houses
description: Lok Sabha has a term of five years unless dissolved earlier; Rajya Sabha is permanent, with one-third of members retiring every two years.

name: Qualifications for Membership
description: Specifies age and citizenship requirements for Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha membership.

name: Sessions of Parliament
description: President summons, prorogues, and dissolves Parliament; Parliament must meet at least twice a year, with a 6-month gap maximum between sessions.

name: Right of President to Address Parliament
description: President may address either or both Houses and send messages requiring consideration.

name: Special Address by President
description: President addresses Parliament at the start of the first session each year.

name: Rights of Ministers and Attorney-General
description: They may participate in House proceedings but cannot vote unless they are members.

name: Chairman and Deputy Chairman of Rajya Sabha
description: Vice-President is ex-officio Chairman; Deputy Chairman elected by members of Rajya Sabha.

name: Powers of Deputy Chairman
description: Deputy Chairman presides in absence of Chairman; exercises all powers of Chairman during such time.

name: Vacation, Resignation, Removal of Deputy Chairman
description: Deputy Chairman may resign, vacate, or be removed by Rajya Sabha members.

name: Presiding in Rajya Sabha
description: If both Chairman and Deputy Chairman absent, members elect a temporary presiding officer.

name: Speaker and Deputy Speaker of Lok Sabha
description: Speaker and Deputy Speaker elected by members of Lok Sabha.

name: Vacation, Resignation, Removal of Speaker/Deputy Speaker
description: They may resign or be removed by a resolution passed by majority of members.

name: Presiding in Lok Sabha
description: In absence of Speaker and Deputy, members elect a member to preside temporarily.

name: Voting in Case of Equality
description: Presiding officer has a casting vote in case of equality of votes.

name: Salaries and Allowances of Presiding Officers
description: Prescribes salary and allowances of Speaker, Deputy Speaker, Chairman, Deputy Chairman.

name: Secretariat of Parliament
description: Both Houses have separate secretariats headed by Secretaries appointed by the President.

name: Oath or Affirmation by Members
description: Members must swear to bear true faith to the Constitution and discharge duties faithfully.

name: Voting and Quorum
description: Quorum is one-tenth of total members; voting can be by voice or division.

name: Vacation of Seats for Dual Membership
description: Members cannot simultaneously be in both Houses; must vacate one seat if elected to both.

name: Disqualifications for Membership
description: Members disqualified under Constitution or law; includes holding office of profit, insolvency, etc.

name: Decision on Disqualification
description: President decides on disqualification based on Election Commission advice.

name: Penalty for Sitting or Voting Illegally
description: Member who sits or votes after disqualification is liable to penalty and may forfeit salary.

name: Powers, Privileges, and Immunities of Parliament Members
description: Members enjoy freedom of speech, immunity from court proceedings for parliamentary actions, and other privileges.

name: Salaries of Members
description: Parliament decides salary, allowances, and pensions of members.

name: Introduction and Passing of Bills
description: Defines the procedure for introduction and passage of bills in Parliament.

name: Joint Sitting of Parliament
description: Provides procedure for joint sitting to resolve deadlocks between Houses.

name: Special Procedure for Money Bills
description: Money Bills must be introduced in Lok Sabha; Rajya Sabha cannot amend or reject, only suggest amendments.

name: Definition of Money Bill
description: Defines a Money Bill as one dealing with taxation, borrowing, appropriation of funds, and expenditure of the Union.

name: President's Assent to Bills
description: Bills passed by Parliament become law only with President's assent; President can withhold, return (except Money Bill), or direct reconsideration.

name: Annual Financial Statement
description: The Budget: annual statement of estimated receipts and expenditure of the Union.

name: Procedure for Estimates
description: Procedure for considering demands for grants and supplementary estimates.

name: Appropriation Bills
description: Provides procedure for Parliament to authorize government expenditure.

name: Supplementary, Additional, and Excess Grants
description: Parliament may authorize expenditure beyond original appropriation.

name: Votes on Account, Votes of Credit, Exceptional Grants
description: Procedure for granting temporary finances when Budget not passed.

name: Special Provisions for Financial Bills
description: Bills affecting taxes, expenditure, or borrowing must be Money Bills or originate in Lok Sabha.

name: Rules of Procedure
description: President may prescribe rules of procedure; Houses may regulate internal business.

name: Legislation by Houses in Financial Matters
description: Special provisions for legislative procedure for money matters.

name: Language of Parliamentary Proceedings
description: English and Hindi used; English documents recognized for legal purposes.

name: Bar on Judicial Interference
description: Courts cannot inquire into proceedings of Parliament except in impeachment cases.

name: Courts not to Question Parliamentary Proceedings
description: Debates, proceedings, and votes cannot be questioned in any court.

name: Ordinance-making power of President
description: President may promulgate ordinances when either House of Parliament is not in session. Ordinances have the force of law but must be approved by Parliament within six weeks of reassembly.

name: Establishment and Constitution of Supreme Court
description: Establishes the Supreme Court of India; outlines appointment, tenure, and qualifications of judges.

name: Salaries of Supreme Court Judges
description: Fixes salaries and allowances for the Chief Justice and other judges of the Supreme Court.

name: Appointment of Acting Chief Justice
description: President may appoint an acting Chief Justice when the office of Chief Justice is vacant or the incumbent is unable to perform duties.

name: Ad hoc Judges
description: Supreme Court may appoint ad hoc judges for temporary periods to deal with increased workload.

name: Attendance of Retired Judges
description: Retired Supreme Court judges may be requested to sit and act temporarily as judges.

name: Supreme Court as Court of Record
description: Supreme Court is a court of record with power to punish for contempt.

name: Seat of Supreme Court
description: Supreme Court shall sit at New Delhi or another place as Parliament may by law provide.

name: Original Jurisdiction
description: Supreme Court has original jurisdiction in disputes between the Union and states or among states.

name: Appellate Jurisdiction in Constitutional Cases
description: Supreme Court can hear appeals against judgments of High Courts in constitutional matters.

name: Appellate Jurisdiction in Civil Matters
description: Supreme Court hears appeals in civil matters involving substantial questions of law.

name: Appellate Jurisdiction in Criminal Matters
description: Supreme Court hears appeals in criminal cases against High Court judgments.

name: Certificate for Appeal
description: High Court may certify certain cases for appeal to Supreme Court.

name: Federal Court Jurisdiction Transferred
description: Jurisdiction previously exercised by the Federal Court transferred to Supreme Court.

name: Special Leave to Appeal
description: Supreme Court may grant special leave to appeal from any judgment or order.

name: Review of Judgments or Orders
description: Supreme Court may review its own judgments or orders.

name: Enlargement of Supreme Court Jurisdiction
description: Parliament may enlarge Supreme Court jurisdiction by law.

name: Power to Issue Writs
description: Supreme Court may issue writs for enforcement of fundamental-rights or for other purposes.

name: Transfer of Certain Cases
description: Supreme Court may transfer cases from one High Court to another or to itself.

name: Ancillary Powers of Supreme Court
description: Supreme Court has powers to make rules regulating practice and procedure.

name: Binding Nature of Supreme Court Decisions
description: Law declared by Supreme Court is binding on all courts within India.

name: Enforcement of Supreme Court Decrees and Orders
description: Supreme Court can pass any order necessary for doing complete justice in any matter before it.

name: Advisory Jurisdiction
description: President may refer questions of law or fact to Supreme Court for advisory opinion.

name: Civil and Judicial Authorities to Act in Aid
description: All authorities must aid the Supreme Court in performing its functions.

name: Rules of Court; Benches
description: Parliament defines rules for Supreme Court procedures and constitution of benches.

name: Officers and Servants of Supreme Court
description: Parliament may prescribe number of officers and servants and conditions of service.

name: Interpretation
description: Defines interpretation rules for Part V provisions related to the Supreme Court.

name: Comptroller and Auditor-General of India
description: Establishes the office of CAG; defines appointment, term, and removal procedure.

name: Duties and Powers of CAG
description: CAG audits accounts of the Union and States; prepares reports for submission to President or Governors.

name: Form of Accounts of Union and States
description: Parliament determines form of accounts for Union and State governments.

name: Audit Reports
description: CAG submits audit reports to President for Union and to Governors for States; laid before Parliament or State Legislatures.

name: The States
description: The territory of India is divided into states and union territories as per the First Schedule.

name: Governor of States
description: There shall be a Governor for each state; he is the constitutional head of the state.

name: Executive Power of the State
description: Executive power of the state is vested in the Governor; exercised directly or through subordinate officers.

name: Appointment of Governors
description: Governors are appointed by the President and hold office during his pleasure.

name: Term of Office of Governor
description: Governor holds office for five years but may resign or be removed earlier.

name: Qualifications for Appointment as Governor
description: Must be a citizen of India, at least 35 years old, and not hold any office of profit.

name: Conditions of Governors Office
description: Governors emoluments and privileges are determined by the President; cannot hold office of profit.

name: Oath or Affirmation by Governor
description: Governor swears to preserve, protect, and defend the Constitution and law of India.

name: Discharge of Functions in Certain Contingencies
description: President may make rules for discharge of Governors functions in contingencies.

name: Pardoning Powers of Governor
description: Governor may grant pardons, reprieves, respites, or remissions for offenses against state law.

name: Extent of Executive Power of State
description: Executive power of state extends to matters on which state legislature may make laws.

name: Council of Ministers to Aid and Advise Governor
description: Governor acts on aid and advice of Council of Ministers; ministers are responsible to the Legislative Assembly.

name: Other Provisions as to Ministers
description: Chief Minister appointed by Governor; other ministers hold office during Governor’s pleasure but are collectively responsible to the Assembly.

name: Advocate-General for the State
description: Legal advisor to state government; rights and duties similar to Attorney-General for Union.

name: Conduct of Business of Government of State
description: Governor makes rules for allocation and transaction of business of state government.

name: Duties of Chief Minister
description: Chief Minister must communicate all decisions and proposals for legislation to Governor.

name: Legislature of States
description: Each state has a Legislative Assembly; some states also have a Legislative Council, as specified in the Constitution.

name: Abolition or Creation of Legislative Councils in States
description: Parliament may by law create or abolish Legislative Councils in states with Legislative Assemblies.

name: Composition of Legislative Assembly
description: Legislative Assembly consists of representatives directly elected by the people of the state; allocation of seats is determined by population.

name: Composition of Legislative Council
description: Legislative Council consists of members elected by Legislative Assembly, local bodies, graduates, teachers, and nominated by Governor.

name: Duration of State Legislatures
description: Legislative Assembly has a term of five years; Legislative Council is permanent with one-third members retiring every two years.

name: Qualifications for Membership
description: Members of Legislative Assembly and Council must be citizens of India, meet age requirements, and not be disqualified under the law.

name: Sessions of Legislature
description: Governor summons, prorogues, and dissolves Legislative Assembly; must meet at least twice a year with a six-month gap maximum.

name: Right of Governor to Address Legislature
description: Governor may address either or both Houses and send messages requiring consideration.

name: Presiding Officers of the Legislative Council
description: Chairman and Deputy Chairman elected by members of Legislative Council.

name: Presiding Officers of the Legislative Assembly
description: Speaker and Deputy Speaker elected by members of Legislative Assembly.

name: Vacation, Resignation, Removal of Speaker and Deputy Speaker
description: Speaker or Deputy Speaker may resign or be removed by resolution passed by majority of members.

name: Eligibility for Presiding Office
description: Members elected as Speaker/Deputy Speaker or Chairman/Deputy Chairman must be members of the House in question.

name: Duration of Office of Presiding Officers
description: Presiding officers hold office until dissolution or for the term of the House, unless they resign or are removed.

name: Speaker or Deputy Speaker Not Subject to Disqualification
description: Presiding officer cannot be disqualified while holding office for acts done in performance of duties.

name: Provisions as to Ministers
description: Chief Minister and other ministers appointed by Governor hold office during Governor’s pleasure and are responsible to Legislative Assembly.

name: Conduct of Government Business
description: Governor makes rules for allocation and transaction of business of state government.

name: Special Powers of High Courts
description: High Courts have original jurisdiction and advisory powers for constitutional matters and legal disputes in the state.

name: Judicial Authority of High Courts
description: High Courts are courts of record and have jurisdiction as determined by law.

name: Conduct of Legislative Assembly Business
description: Rules governing procedure, quorum, and voting are determined by the House.

name: Secretariat of State Legislatures
description: Each House has a secretariat headed by a Secretary appointed by Governor.

name: Oath or Affirmation by Members
description: Members must swear to bear true faith to Constitution and perform duties faithfully.

name: Voting and Quorum
description: Quorum required for conducting business; voting by voice, division, or as per rules of the House.

name: Vacation of Seats for Dual Membership
description: Members cannot hold membership in both Houses simultaneously; must vacate one.

name: Disqualifications for Membership
description: Members disqualified for office of profit, insolvency, or other reasons specified by law.

name: Decision on Disqualification
description: Governor decides on disqualification based on Election Commission advice.

name: Penalty for Sitting or Voting Illegally
description: Member who acts after disqualification may forfeit salary and allowances.

name: Powers, Privileges, and Immunities of Members
description: Members enjoy freedom of speech, immunity from court proceedings, and other privileges.

name: Salaries of Members
description: State legislatures decide salaries, allowances, and pensions of their members.

name: Introduction and Passing of Bills
description: Procedure for introducing, debating, and passing bills in state legislatures.

name: Governor's Assent to Bills
description: Governor can assent to bills, withhold, return for reconsideration, or reserve for President's consideration.

name: Money Bills
description: Money bills must originate in Legislative Assembly; Legislative Council can only recommend amendments.

name: Annual Financial Statement
description: State government submits estimated receipts and expenditure to the legislature (Budget).

name: Appropriation Bills
description: Legislature authorizes expenditure from the Consolidated Fund of the state.

name: Supplementary, Additional, and Excess Grants
description: Legislature may authorize extra expenditure beyond original appropriations.

name: Votes on Account, Votes of Credit, Exceptional Grants
description: Temporary finances for government if budget not passed.

name: Rules of Procedure
description: State legislatures may make rules for procedure and conduct of business.

name: Language of Legislative Proceedings
description: Legislature may use English or the state official language for proceedings.

name: Courts not to Question Proceedings
description: Judicial authorities cannot inquire into proceedings of the legislature.

name: Ordinances by Governor
description: Governor may promulgate ordinances when legislature not in session; must be approved within six weeks of reconvening.

name: Special Provisions
description: State legislatures follow rules set by Governor and Constitution for financial and other matters.

name: Secretariat
description: Each House has a secretariat headed by Secretary appointed by Governor.

name: Oath or Affirmation by Members
description: Members swear to uphold Constitution and perform duties faithfully.

name: Voting and Quorum
description: Defines quorum and voting methods for state legislatures.

name: Vacation of Seats
description: Rules for vacating seats due to resignation, disqualification, or dissolution.

name: Disqualifications
description: Members disqualified under law cannot sit or vote in legislature.

name: Ordinances by Governor
description: When the state legislature is not in session, the Governor may promulgate ordinances which have the same force as laws passed by the legislature.

name: States to Maintain a Public Service
description: States must maintain a public service responsible for executing laws.

name: High Courts for States
description: Each state shall have a High Court; Parliament may establish a common High Court for two or more states.

name: Constitution of High Court
description: High Courts consist of a Chief Justice and other judges appointed by the President.

name: Appointment and Conditions of Judges of High Court
description: Judges of High Court are appointed by President, hold office until 62, and can be removed by impeachment.

name: Additional and Acting Judges
description: High Courts may appoint additional or acting judges as necessary.

name: Oath or Affirmation by Judges
description: Judges swear to uphold Constitution and faithfully discharge duties.

name: Jurisdiction of High Courts
description: High Courts are courts of record and exercise original and appellate jurisdiction.

name: Transfer of Judges
description: Supreme Court may transfer a judge from one High Court to another in public interest.

name: Control over Subordinate Courts
description: High Courts supervise and control subordinate courts in the state.

name: Power to Authorize Additional Judges
description: President may authorize additional judges in High Courts temporarily.

name: Appointment of Acting Judges
description: Acting judges may be appointed to handle extra workload.

name: Attendance of Retired Judges
description: Retired judges may be requested to act temporarily.

name: Power of High Courts to Issue Writs
description: High Courts may issue writs for enforcement of fundamental-rights and for any other purpose.

name: Power of Superintendence over Lower Courts
description: High Courts supervise all subordinate courts and tribunals in the state.

name: Constitution of High Courts for Union Territories
description: Parliament may establish High Courts for Union Territories and decide their composition and jurisdiction.

name: Appointments of Officers
description: Parliament may provide for the appointment and tenure of officers in High Courts for Union Territories.

name: Salaries and Allowances of Judges
description: Prescribes salaries and allowances for High Court judges.

name: Comptroller and Auditor-General of India
description: CAG audits accounts of states and submits reports to Governor; same as union provisions.

name: Audit Reports
description: CAG submits audit reports to Governor; laid before state legislature.

name: Appointment of District Judges
description: District judges appointed by Governor in consultation with High Court.

name: Appointment of Additional District Judges
description: Governor may appoint additional judges in consultation with High Court.

name: Control over Subordinate Courts
description: High Court exercises control over subordinate courts in the state.

name: Special Provisions for Certain States
description: Parliament may provide special arrangements for states requiring it.

name: Application of Union Laws to Certain States
description: Union laws may extend to certain states with modifications by Parliament.

name: Application of Laws to Part B States
description: All laws in force in Part B states immediately before the commencement of the Constitution continue until altered or repealed by Parliament. The President may make regulations for peace, progress, and good government of Part B states.

name: Governors for Union Territories
description: President appoints an Administrator for each Union Territory to exercise powers and functions of the Union government in the territory.

name: Legislature or Council of Ministers for Certain Union Territories
description: Parliament may by law create a legislature or council of ministers for a Union Territory to provide for governance and law-making.

name: President's Rule in Union Territories
description: President may make regulations for peace, progress, and good government of Union Territories not having a legislature, and may extend or amend laws with suitable adaptations.

name: High Courts for Union Territories
description: Parliament may establish High Courts for Union Territories or provide for their jurisdiction by adapting provisions applicable to states.

name: Application of Union Laws
description: Laws made by Parliament for Union Territories may include modifications or adaptations to suit specific territories.

name: Definitions
description: Defines key terms used in Part IX, including 'Panchayati Raj Institution', 'Gram Sabha', 'Panchayat', and 'State'.

name: Gram Sabha
description: Every village shall have a Gram Sabha consisting of persons registered as voters; it exercises powers and responsibilities as provided by law.

name: Constitution of Panchayats
description: Panchayats shall be constituted at the village, intermediate, and district levels in every state, as specified by law.

name: Composition of Panchayats
description: Panchayats at each level are composed of members elected from territorial constituencies in the state.

name: Composition of Panchayats at Intermediate and District Levels
description: Specifies method of election, composition, and representation for Panchayats at intermediate and district levels.

name: Elections to the Panchayats
description: Elections conducted by State Election Commission; members chosen by direct elections from territorial constituencies.

name: Duration of Panchayats
description: Panchayats have a term of five years; provisions for dissolution and continuation of business are specified.

name: Powers, Authority, and Responsibilities of Panchayats
description: Panchayats have powers to prepare plans and implement schemes for economic development and social justice as assigned by the state legislature.

name: Power to Impose Taxes
description: Panchayats may levy and collect taxes, duties, tolls, and fees for the purpose of performing their functions.

name: Provisions as to the State Finance Commission
description: State Finance Commission recommended by Governor to review financial position and recommend distribution of funds to Panchayats.

name: Audit of Accounts of Panchayats
description: State government audits Panchayat accounts; accounts and audit reports presented to the state legislature.

name: Elections to the Panchayats
description: State Election Commission supervises, directs, and controls elections to Panchayats.

name: Application of the Provisions to the Union Territories
description: Provisions of this Part apply to Union Territories as Parliament may specify by law.

name: Powers, Authority, and Responsibilities of Panchayats in Union Territories
description: Union Territory Panchayats shall have powers and responsibilities similar to those in states, as prescribed by Parliament.

name: Constitution of Finance Commission in Union Territories
description: President may constitute Finance Commission for Union Territories to recommend distribution of funds to Panchayats.

name: Savings
description: Nothing in this Part shall affect the powers of Parliament or state legislatures to make laws relating to Panchayats.

name: Municipalities Definitions
description: Defines key terms used in Part IXA, including 'Municipality', 'Chairperson', and 'Ward Committee'.

name: Constitution of Municipalities
description: Municipalities shall be constituted in every urban area with such powers and responsibilities as the state legislature may specify.

name: Composition of Municipalities
description: Municipalities consist of members elected from territorial constituencies called wards and may include nominated members.

name: Duration of Municipalities
description: Municipalities have a term of five years; provisions for dissolution and continuation of business are specified.

name: Reservation of Seats
description: Seats are reserved for Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and women as per law for fair representation in Municipalities.

name: Officers and Staff of Municipalities
description: State legislature provides for appointment of officers and employees necessary for the administration of Municipalities.

name: Powers, Authority, and Responsibilities of Municipalities
description: Municipalities are responsible for preparing plans for economic development, social justice, and urban governance in their areas.

name: Elections to Municipalities
description: State Election Commission conducts, supervises, and controls elections to Municipalities.

name: Finance Commission
description: State Finance Commission recommends distribution of financial resources between the state and Municipalities.

name: Application to Union Territories
description: Provisions of Part IXA apply to Union Territories as specified by Parliament.

name: Savings
description: Nothing in this Part affects the power of Parliament or state legislatures to make laws regarding Municipalities.

name: Special Provisions for Certain Areas
description: Parliament or state legislatures may provide special arrangements for Municipalities in certain areas.

name: Ward Committees
description: In larger urban areas, Ward Committees may be constituted for decentralized governance.

name: District Planning Committees
description: District Planning Committees prepare draft development plans integrating urban and rural planning in the district.

name: Metropolitan Planning Committees
description: In metropolitan areas, Planning Committees prepare draft development plans integrating all municipalities in the area.

name: Powers and Functions of Planning Committees
description: Planning Committees coordinate planning for economic development and social justice within their jurisdiction.

name: Composition of Metropolitan and District Planning Committees
description: Committees are composed of elected members of local bodies and representatives of state legislature, as specified by law.

name: Savings
description: Nothing in this Part affects the powers of Parliament or state legislatures to make laws regarding Municipalities and planning committees.

name: Administration of Scheduled Areas and Tribal Areas
description: Parliament and state legislatures may make laws for the administration of Scheduled Areas and Tribal Areas. Scheduled Areas are under the Governor’s administration with special responsibilities for welfare and protection of tribal communities.

name: Creation of an Autonomous State within a State
description: Parliament may create an autonomous state within a state having a legislature and council of ministers for self-governance in tribal areas, subject to special provisions and safeguards.

name: Extent of Laws Made by Parliament and by the Legislatures of States
description: Parliament and state legislatures may make laws for the whole or any part of India, but Parliament can make laws on matters in the Union List, and states on matters in the State List.

name: Subjects of Union, State and Concurrent Lists
description: Defines the legislative powers of Parliament and state legislatures as per the Union List, State List, and Concurrent List in the Seventh Schedule.

name: Power of Parliament to Provide for Certain Matters Relating to the Lists
description: Parliament may make laws on certain matters in the State List in the national interest or to implement agreements with states.

name: Residuary Powers of Parliament
description: Parliament has exclusive power to make laws on any matter not enumerated in the State List or Union List.

name: Power of Parliament to Legislate in the National Interest
description: Parliament may legislate on a State List matter if Rajya Sabha passes a resolution supported by two-thirds of members present and voting.

name: Legislation for Giving Effect to International Agreements
description: Parliament may legislate on any matter in the State List to implement international agreements.

name: Inconsistency Between Laws Made by Parliament and Laws Made by the Legislatures of States
description: In case of conflict between Union and State laws on concurrent subjects, Union law prevails; if both are made after commencement of the Constitution and approved by President, Union law prevails.

name: Power of Parliament to Legislate for Two or More States by Consent and Adoption of Such Law by Any Other State
description: Parliament may legislate for two or more states with their consent; other states may adopt the law by resolution.

name: Legislation for Giving Effect to International Agreements and Treaties
description: Parliament may make laws to implement international treaties and agreements, even if the subject is in the State List.

name: Inconsistency of Laws
description: If a state law conflicts with a Union law on a concurrent subject, Union law prevails; state law void to extent of inconsistency unless approved by President.

name: Delegation of Legislative Powers
description: Parliament or state legislature may delegate legislative powers to authorities in certain cases as per law.

name: Obligation of States and the Union
description: States must ensure that Union laws are executed; Union may give directions to states as necessary.

name: Control of the Union Over States in Certain Cases
description: Union can give directions to states to ensure proper governance and development.

name: Consent of States Required for the Exercise of Certain Functions by the Union
description: Union government may exercise functions normally reserved for states with state consent.

name: Extension of Powers of Parliament to Certain Matters in the State List
description: Parliament may legislate on state subjects if Rajya Sabha resolves it is necessary in national interest.

name: Disputes Relating to Waters of Inter-State Rivers or River Valleys
description: Disputes regarding waters of inter-state rivers or river valleys resolved by Union Parliament or adjudicated by tribunals.

name: Public Acts, Records, and Judicial Proceedings
description: Full faith and credit shall be given throughout India to public acts, records, and judicial proceedings of Union and states.

name: Adjudication of Disputes Relating to Waters of Inter-State Rivers or River Valleys
description: Parliament may provide for adjudication of disputes relating to waters of inter-state rivers or river valleys by tribunals.

name: Inter-State Council
description: President may establish an Inter-State Council to discuss and recommend policies on disputes and coordination between Union and states.

name: Interpretation
description: Explanation of certain financial terms used in this Part.

name: Taxes not to be Imposed save by Authority of Law
description: No tax shall be levied or collected except by authority of law.

name: Consolidated Funds and Public Accounts
description: Specifies creation and maintenance of Consolidated Fund of India, Consolidated Funds of States, and Public Accounts.

name: Contingency Fund
description: Contingency Fund of India and of states maintained for unexpected expenditure.

name: Taxes levied by the Union but collected and appropriated by the States
description: Certain taxes assigned to states though levied by Union.

name: Taxes levied and collected by the Union but assigned to the States
description: Certain taxes collected by Union but assigned to states; details of collection and allocation specified.

name: Taxes levied and distributed between Union and States
description: Certain taxes levied by Union shared between Union and states as specified.

name: Surcharge on Certain Duties and Taxes for Purposes of the Union
description: Parliament may levy surcharge on certain taxes for Union purposes.

name: Repealed
description: This article is omitted and has no content.

name: Grants in Lieu of Export Duty on jute and jute products
description: Union may provide grants in lieu of export duty on jute and jute products to states.

name: Recommendations of President as to Appropriations
description: President recommends to Parliament appropriations from Consolidated Fund.

name: Grants from Union to certain States
description: Union provides grants to states for promotion of welfare and development.

name: Taxes on Professions, Trades, Callings and Employments
description: State legislatures may levy taxes on professions, trades, callings, and employments.

name: Repealed
description: This article has been repealed and has no content.

name: Liability of States in Respect of Certain Expenses of Union
description: Certain expenses of Union chargeable on states, e.g., contributions to defense.

name: Finance Commission
description: President constitutes a Finance Commission every five years to recommend distribution of revenues between Union and states.

name: Finance Commission
description: Details powers, functions, and recommendations of Finance Commission for equitable distribution of revenues.

name: Recommendations of Finance Commission
description: Finance Commission makes recommendations on distribution of net proceeds of taxes and grants-in-aid.

name: Grants by the Union to States
description: Union may make grants to states for any public purpose even if not required by Constitution.

name: Custody, etc., of Consolidated Funds and of moneys credited to the Public Accounts
description: Custody of funds of Union and states maintained under Consolidated Fund or Public Accounts.

name: Custody of suable moneys
description: All suable moneys of the Union or states kept in custody of Union or state authorities.

name: Exemption of property of the Union from State taxation
description: Property of Union is exempt from state taxation.

name: Restrictions as to imposition of tax on the sale or purchase of goods
description: Provisions for restrictions on sales tax on goods moving between states.

name: Exemption from taxes on electricity
description: Union and state properties producing electricity may be exempt from taxation under certain conditions.

name: Taxes on railway fares and freights
description: Union may levy taxes on railways; states may levy duties on railways in certain cases.

name: Exemption from taxes on ships and vessels
description: Ships and vessels owned by Union exempt from certain taxes.

name: Adjustment of Grants-in-Aid in Respect of certain taxes
description: Provisions for adjustment of grants and revenues between Union and states.

name: Repealed
description: This article has been repealed and has no content.

name: Borrowing by the Union
description: Union may borrow within India or outside for purposes of the Union.

name: Borrowing by States
description: States may borrow within India for purposes of the state; conditions subject to Union law.

name: Revenue of Union and States
description: All revenues received by Union or states are credited to Consolidated Fund.

name: Property of the Union and of the States
description: Union and states have ownership of property acquired or assigned to them.

name: Property of the Union
description: Union owns all property vested in it and under its control.

name: Property of States
description: States own property vested in them and under their control.

name: Power of the Union and the States to Trade, etc.
description: Union and states may carry on trade, business, or manufacturing; conditions prescribed by law.

name: Contracts on behalf of the Union
description: All contracts made in name of Union must be executed in prescribed manner; same for states.

name: Suits and Proceedings
description: Union and states may sue or be sued by name of Union or state.

name: Right to Property
description: No person shall be deprived of property except by authority of law.

name: Freedom of Trade, Commerce and Intercourse
description: Trade, commerce, and intercourse throughout the territory of India shall be free.

name: Power of Parliament to Impose Restrictions on Trade, Commerce and Intercourse
description: Parliament may impose restrictions on trade and commerce in the public interest by law.

name: Restriction on Trade and Commerce within a State
description: State legislatures cannot enact laws that obstruct free trade, commerce, or intercourse, except under Parliament-approved exceptions.

name: Restrictions on Trade and Commerce within a State
description: State legislature may impose reasonable restrictions in public interest and levy duties on goods within state; must not discriminate between states or goods.

name: Saving of Existing Laws and Laws Providing for State Monopolies
description: Existing laws or state monopolies in trade or commerce are saved; they continue despite other provisions of this Part.

name: Repealed
description: This article has been repealed and has no content.

name: Appointment of Authority for Carrying Out the Purposes of Articles 301 to 304
description: President may appoint authorities for supervision and regulation of trade and commerce between states to ensure free flow of goods.

name: Definitions
description: Defines key terms used in Part XIV, including 'All-India Services', 'State Services', and 'Union Services'.

name: Recruitment and Conditions of Service of Persons Serving the Union or a State
description: Parliament or the state legislature may regulate recruitment and conditions of service of persons serving under the Union or states.

name: Tenure of Office of Persons Serving the Union or a State
description: Persons serving under the Union or states hold office during the pleasure of the President or Governor, subject to other provisions of the Constitution.

name: Dismissal, Removal or Reduction in Rank of Persons Serving the Union or a State
description: Rules regarding disciplinary action, dismissal, removal, or reduction in rank, with safeguards for civil servants.

name: All-India Services
description: Parliament may create new All-India Services common to Union and states, in addition to existing services like IAS, IPS.

name: Suspension of a Member of a State Service or the All-India Service
description: Temporary suspension provisions for members of state or All-India Services in case of pending investigation or proceedings.

name: Repealed
description: This article has been repealed and has no content.

name: Public Service Commissions for the Union and the States
description: Establishment of Union and State Public Service Commissions to conduct recruitment and advise on service matters.

name: Appointment and Term of Office of Members
description: Members of Public Service Commissions appointed by President or Governor, with a tenure of six years or until age 62.

name: Removal and Suspension of a Member of a Public Service Commission
description: Conditions and procedure for removal or suspension of commission members.

name: Conditions of Service of Members and Staff of the Commissions
description: Regulates conditions of service, salaries, and allowances of commission members and staff.

name: Prohibition as to Further Employment
description: Restrictions on employment after retirement or resignation from certain services.

name: Functions of the Public Service Commissions
description: Advises on recruitment, promotions, transfers, disciplinary matters, and other service-related matters.

name: Power of the Legislature of a State to Extend the Functions of Public Service Commission
description: State legislature may extend functions of the state Public Service Commission beyond constitutional provisions.

name: Expenses of Public Service Commissions
description: Salaries, allowances, and expenses of the commissions charged to the Consolidated Fund of India or the state.

name: Reports of the Public Service Commissions
description: Commissions submit annual reports to the President or Governor; reports laid before Parliament or the state legislature.

name: Administrative Tribunals
description: Parliament may by law provide for the adjudication or trial of disputes and complaints regarding recruitment, and conditions of service of persons appointed to public services and posts in connection with the affairs of the Union or of any State.

name: Tribunals for Other Matters
description: Parliament or state legislatures may establish tribunals for the adjudication of disputes related to taxes, foreign exchange, industrial and labour matters, land reforms, and other specified areas.

name: Superintendence, Direction, and Control of Elections
description: Elections to Parliament, state legislatures, and offices of President and Vice-President shall be conducted by the Election Commission, which has superintendence, direction, and control over them.

name: No Person to be ineligible on Grounds of Religion, Race, Caste, or Sex
description: No person shall be disqualified from being a voter on the grounds of religion, race, caste, or sex.

name: Elections to the House of the People and to the Legislative Assemblies of States to be on the Basis of Adult Suffrage
description: Elections to Lok Sabha and state assemblies shall be based on adult suffrage; every citizen of India who is 18 years or older has the right to vote.

name: Power of Parliament to Enact Laws Relating to Elections
description: Parliament may regulate the conduct of elections to Parliament and state legislatures, including preparation of electoral rolls and allocation of constituencies.

name: Power of Legislature of a State to Enact Laws Relating to Elections to the Legislature of the State
description: State legislatures may make laws regarding elections to state assemblies and legislative councils, subject to provisions of Parliament law.

name: Bar to interference by Courts in Electoral Matters
description: Courts shall not interfere in matters relating to elections to Parliament or state legislatures, except as expressly provided by law.

name: Repealed
description: This article has been repealed and has no content.

name: Reservation of Seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the House of the People
description: Seats are reserved in the Lok Sabha for Scheduled Castes (SCs) and Scheduled Tribes (STs) in proportion to their population in each state.

name: Representation of the Anglo-Indian Community in the House of the People
description: President may nominate members of the Anglo-Indian community to the Lok Sabha if the community is not adequately represented.

name: Reservation of Seats for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes in the Legislative Assemblies of the States
description: Seats are reserved in state assemblies for SCs and STs in proportion to their population in each state.

name: Representation of the Anglo-Indian Community in the Legislative Assemblies of the States
description: Governor may nominate members of the Anglo-Indian community to the state legislative assembly if the community is not adequately represented.

name: Reservation of Seats and Representation of the Anglo-Indian Community to Cease After Certain Period
description: Reservations of seats for SCs, STs, and Anglo-Indian community representation in legislatures are subject to periodic review by Parliament; initially set for 10 years after commencement of Constitution, extendable by law.

name: Claims of Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes to Services and Posts
description: SCs and STs have claims to appointments and promotions in public services consistent with efficiency of administration.

name: Special Provision for Public Service Commission in Union Territories
description: Provisions regarding recruitment and service conditions for Union Territories in respect of SCs and STs.

name: Special Provision with Respect to Educational Grants for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes
description: President may make grants to states to promote education among SCs and STs.

name: National Commission for Scheduled Castes
description: National Commission for SCs established to investigate and monitor safeguards, evaluate working of protective measures, and report to President.

name: National Commission for Scheduled Tribes
description: National Commission for STs established to investigate and monitor safeguards, evaluate working of protective measures, and report to President.

name: Control of the Union Over Scheduled Areas and Tribes
description: President may issue regulations for the welfare and administration of Scheduled Areas and STs; includes supervision of money grants and developmental schemes.

name: Appointment of a Commission to Investigate Conditions of Backward Classes
description: President may appoint a commission to investigate socially and educationally backward classes and recommend measures for their advancement.

name: Scheduled Castes
description: President specifies SCs for purposes of the Constitution; Parliament may modify list by law.

name: Scheduled Tribes
description: President specifies STs for purposes of the Constitution; Parliament may modify list by law.

name: Official Language of the Union
description: The official language of the Union shall be Hindi in Devanagari script; English may also be used for official purposes for a transitional period as provided.

name: Commission and Committee of Parliament on Official Language
description: Provides for the establishment of a Commission to promote the progressive use of Hindi and a Committee to report on the practical aspects of language policy.

name: Official Language of a State
description: Legislature of a state may adopt any language used in the state as its official language for all or any official purposes.

name: Official Language for Communication Between the Union and a State
description: Specifies the language to be used for official communication between the Union and the states; Hindi and English may be used as per law or agreement.

name: Special Provision Relating to Language Spoken by a Section of the Population of a State
description: President may recognize a language spoken by a section of a state’s population for official purposes if requested by state legislature.

name: Language to be Used in the Supreme Court and High Courts and for Acts, Bills, etc.
description: Hindi or English may be used in Supreme Court and High Courts; bills and acts of Parliament initially in English or Hindi.

name: Special Directive for the Development of the Hindi Language
description: President may give directives for developing Hindi language to ensure it becomes a medium for official and scientific work.

name: Languages for Instruction in Education
description: States and Union should provide facilities for instruction in mother tongue at primary stage and ensure adequate representation of minorities.

name: Facilities for Instruction in Mother Tongue at Primary Stage
description: Every state and Union territory shall provide adequate facilities for instruction in mother tongue at primary stage to children belonging to linguistic minority groups.

name: Special Officer for Linguistic Minorities
description: President appoints a Special Officer to investigate and report on safeguards provided to linguistic minorities.

name: Directive for Development of Hindi
description: Union shall take steps to promote Hindi language so that it may serve as a medium of expression for all elements of the Indian population.

name: Proclamation of Emergency
description: President may proclaim National Emergency on grounds of war, external aggression, or armed rebellion. Parliament must approve the proclamation within one month.

name: Effect of Proclamation of Emergency
description: During emergency, the executive power of the Union extends to giving directions to states; Parliament may make laws on state subjects.

name: Financial Provisions during Emergency
description: Distribution of revenues between Union and states may be varied; grants may be made to states out of the Consolidated Fund of India.

name: Duty of the Union to Protect States
description: Union shall protect states from external aggression and internal disturbances and ensure that government in a state is carried on according to the Constitution.

name: Provisions in Case of Failure of Constitutional Machinery in States
description: President may assume control of state government if constitutional machinery fails; Parliament approves and can legislate for the state during such period.

name: Exercise of Legislative Powers under Provisions of Article 356
description: Parliament may confer powers on Union authorities to legislate for states under President’s rule.

name: Suspension of the Provisions of Article 19 During Emergency
description: fundamental-rights under Article 19 are automatically suspended during a National Emergency proclaimed under Article 352.

name: Suspension of the Provisions of Article 19 and of Enforcement of Other fundamental-rights During Emergency
description: President may suspend enforcement of fundamental-rights under Articles 19, 20, and 21 during National Emergency; Parliament may approve extension.

name: Financial Emergency
description: President may proclaim Financial Emergency if financial stability or credit of India is threatened; Parliament must approve. During such emergency, Union can give directions to states regarding financial matters.

name: Protection of President and Governors
description: The President and the Governors are not answerable to any court for the exercise of their powers and duties. No civil or criminal proceedings can be initiated against them during their term of office without prior sanction.

name: Oaths and Affirmations
description: Provision for oaths or affirmations by certain persons holding public offices, as prescribed by law.

name: Provisions Relating to the Conduct of Business in States under the Governor
description: States under certain conditions like President’s rule have their administration conducted by Union authorities, as provided by law.

name: Annual Financial Statement
description: Union budget or annual financial statement must be laid before both Houses of Parliament, specifying estimated receipts and expenditure.

name: Effect of Failure to Comply with Directions of the Union
description: Failure by a state to comply with directions issued by Union may lead to President's rule or other measures under the Constitution.

name: Definitions
description: Defines key terms used throughout the Constitution, such as 'State', 'Government', 'Union', etc.

name: Interpretation
description: Provides guidelines for interpretation of the Constitution, its provisions, and definitions used within.

name: Power of Parliament to Amend the Constitution and Procedure Therefor
description: Parliament may amend the Constitution by adding, varying, or repealing provisions. Amendments can be made by a special majority of both Houses and, in certain cases, require ratification by half of the state legislatures. The basic structure of the Constitution cannot be altered.

name: Application of Certain Provisions to Goa, Daman and Diu
description: Certain provisions of the Constitution shall apply to the Union territory of Goa, Daman, and Diu as adapted by Parliament.

name: Temporary Provisions with Respect to the State of Jammu and Kashmir
description: Special provisions related to the State of Jammu and Kashmir, including autonomy in its internal administration; Parliament's powers are limited except as extended by the state.

name: Special Provisions for States
description: Special provisions for various states like Maharashtra, Gujarat, Nagaland, Assam, Manipur, Andhra Pradesh, Sikkim, Mizoram, Arunachal Pradesh, Goa, and others regarding administration, legislature, and representation.

name: Special Provisions for Nagaland
description: Autonomy for Nagaland in religious or social practices, customary law, and ownership of land and resources.

name: Special Provisions for Assam
description: Special administrative provisions for certain tribal areas in Assam and representation in the legislature.

name: Special Provision for Manipur
description: Special administrative provisions for hill areas in Manipur.

name: Special Provisions for Andhra Pradesh
description: Reservation of posts and educational opportunities for local people of different regions of Andhra Pradesh.

name: Special Provisions for Andhra Pradesh
description: Establishment of University for backward classes in Andhra Pradesh.

name: Special Provisions for Sikkim
description: Autonomy and special legislative powers for Sikkim, representation in Parliament.

name: Special Provision for Mizoram
description: Autonomy for Mizoram in religious and social practices, customary law, and resource management.

name: Special Provision for Arunachal Pradesh
description: Governor’s special responsibilities and legislative powers in Arunachal Pradesh.

name: Special Provision for Goa
description: Governor’s powers and administration of state legislative procedures in Goa.

name: Continuance in Force of Existing Laws and Their Adaptation
description: All laws in force before commencement of Constitution continue until altered or repealed by competent authority.

name: Application of Indian Penal Code to State of Jammu and Kashmir
description: Indian Penal Code, Criminal Procedure Code, and other central laws do not automatically apply to Jammu and Kashmir except as extended by the state legislature.

name: Short Title
description: The Constitution may be called 'The Constitution of India'.

name: Commencement of the Constitution
